Question: This person was associated with the Texas Outlaw Comics group developed at the Comedy Workshop in Houston in the 1980s.
Hints: Much of this person's routine involved direct attacks on mainstream society, religion, politics, and consumerism.
This person often discussed conspiracy theories in his performances, most notably the assassination of President John F Kennedy.
Likewise, in "Comedy Central Presents: 100 Greatest Stand-ups of All Time" (2004), this person was ranked at #19.
